definitions: Past tense of break: to separate into pieces suddenly or violently by hitting or dropping.
Past tense of break: to interrupt the continuity, especially of a surface or line.
Past tense of break: to fail to observe a law, rule, or convention.
Past tense of break: to make or become known.
Past tense of break: to cause to become inoperative or unusable.
Past tense of break: to tame an animal, especially a horse, for riding or work.
Past tense of break: to surpass a record or barrier.
